events.name: Russian air strikes on Idlib province, Syria
events.wd_label: Russian air strikes on Idlib province, Syria
events.wd_description: At least nine people were reportedly killed after Russian air strikes on the rebel-held Idlib province in Syria. The United Nations expressed concerns about the hostilities in the province.
events.description: At least nine people were reportedly killed after Russian air strikes on the rebel-held Idlib province in Syria. The United Nations expressed concerns about the hostilities in the province.

events.name: Casualties in Idlib
events.wd_description: Bombs dropped from warplanes killed nine people next to a market outside Jisr al-Shughour, and two others were killed in an air strike near Idlib city.
events.description: Bombs dropped from warplanes killed nine people next to a market outside Jisr al-Shughour, and two others were killed in an air strike near Idlib city.

events.name: Monitoring group's statement
events.wd_description: The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights monitoring group termed the attack the deadliest Russian attack this year.
events.description: The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights monitoring group termed the attack the deadliest Russian attack this year.

events.name: Russia's response
events.wd_description: Russia's military did not comment on the situation immediately. Their air campaign supporting the Syrian government has been crucial in turning the tide of the civil war.
events.description: Russia's military did not comment on the situation immediately. Their air campaign supporting the Syrian government has been crucial in turning the tide of the civil war.

events.name: Retaliation for attacks
events.wd_description: The strikes were said to be a retaliation for attacks that had killed civilians in government-held Hama and Latakia provinces.
events.description: The strikes were said to be a retaliation for attacks that had killed civilians in government-held Hama and Latakia provinces.

events.name: Global Temperatures Surge to Record Highs in June 2023
events.wd_label: Global Temperatures Surge to Record Highs in June 2023
events.wd_description: Global temperatures reached record highs in June 2023, with average temperatures 1°C higher than historical averages for the month, signaling an intensifying climate crisis that may make this year the warmest on record.
events.description: Global temperatures reached record highs in June 2023, with average temperatures 1°C higher than historical averages for the month, signaling an intensifying climate crisis that may make this year the warmest on record.

events.name: Record-High Global Temperatures
events.wd_description: Global average temperatures in June 2023 are approximately 1°C higher than those recorded for the same month since 1979, continuing a trend of intensifying global warming that could make this year the warmest on record.
events.description: Global average temperatures in June 2023 are approximately 1°C higher than those recorded for the same month since 1979, continuing a trend of intensifying global warming that could make this year the warmest on record.

events.name: Impact of Heatwaves and Wildfires
events.wd_description: The surge in global temperatures has led to catastrophic heatwaves in regions from Puerto Rico to Siberia, and massive wildfires in Canada have caused hazardous smoke conditions in cities like New York and Washington.
events.description: The surge in global temperatures has led to catastrophic heatwaves in regions from Puerto Rico to Siberia, and massive wildfires in Canada have caused hazardous smoke conditions in cities like New York and Washington.

events.name: Unprecedented Ocean Warming
events.wd_description: June 2023 also marked the second consecutive month of record-high ocean surface temperatures, contributing to overall global temperature rise, affecting marine life, coral reefs, and causing sea level rise.
events.description: June 2023 also marked the second consecutive month of record-high ocean surface temperatures, contributing to overall global temperature rise, affecting marine life, coral reefs, and causing sea level rise.

events.name: Extreme Weather and Smoke Pollution Affect Vast Regions of the United States
events.wd_label: Extreme Weather and Smoke Pollution Affect Vast Regions of the United States
events.wd_description: Large parts of the United States are facing extreme weather, with triple-digit temperatures in the south and southwest and widespread smoke pollution in the Midwest due to fires in northern Quebec. Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, and more than 40 million are under excessive heat notifications.
events.description: Large parts of the United States are facing extreme weather, with triple-digit temperatures in the south and southwest and widespread smoke pollution in the Midwest due to fires in northern Quebec. Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, and more than 40 million are under excessive heat notifications.

events.name: Extreme Heat in Southern and Southwestern US
events.wd_label: Extreme Heat in Southern and Southwestern US
events.wd_description: Temperatures in the southern and southwestern United States have reached triple digits, with a heat dome contributing to widespread excessive heat warnings affecting more than 40 million Americans.
events.description: Temperatures in the southern and southwestern United States have reached triple digits, with a heat dome contributing to widespread excessive heat warnings affecting more than 40 million Americans.

events.name: Smoke Pollution in the Midwest
events.wd_description: Smoke from fires in northern Quebec has caused significant air pollution across the Midwest, with smoke being carried southward by a north wind, affecting regions including southern Illinois, Indiana, and Kentucky.
events.description: Smoke from fires in northern Quebec has caused significant air pollution across the Midwest, with smoke being carried southward by a north wind, affecting regions including southern Illinois, Indiana, and Kentucky.

events.name: Warnings and Public Health Precautions
events.wd_description: Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, with officials in cities like Chicago advising vulnerable populations to stay indoors. Daycare and sports centers have also taken precautions to protect children from the smoke.
events.description: Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, with officials in cities like Chicago advising vulnerable populations to stay indoors. Daycare and sports centers have also taken precautions to protect children from the smoke.

events.name: Cornell study on U.S. EV battery production and sustainability
events.wd_label: Cornell study on U.S. EV battery production and sustainability
events.wd_description: A Cornell study examines the long-term energy and sustainability prospects of U.S. EV battery production and highlights policy approaches for building a more resilient battery supply chain.
events.description: A Cornell study examines the long-term energy and sustainability prospects of U.S. EV battery production and highlights policy approaches for building a more resilient battery supply chain.

events.name: Federal government incentives
events.wd_description: The federal government is incentivizing the expansion of domestic electric-vehicle battery manufacturing to reduce dependence on foreign imports and unpredictable global supply chains.
events.description: The federal government is incentivizing the expansion of domestic electric-vehicle battery manufacturing to reduce dependence on foreign imports and unpredictable global supply chains.

events.name: Study publication
events.wd_description: A study published in Science Advances provides a comprehensive energy and environmental analysis of reshoring lithium-ion EV batteries, considering the entire life cycle.
events.description: A study published in Science Advances provides a comprehensive energy and environmental analysis of reshoring lithium-ion EV batteries, considering the entire life cycle.

events.name: Benefits of reshoring
events.wd_description: Reshoring could reduce the overall carbon footprint of U.S. EV batteries and the energy needed to produce them, with benefits varying based on technology advances, supply chain restructuring, and EV adoption.
events.description: Reshoring could reduce the overall carbon footprint of U.S. EV batteries and the energy needed to produce them, with benefits varying based on technology advances, supply chain restructuring, and EV adoption.

events.name: Importance of recycled materials
events.wd_description: Utilizing recycled aluminum and nickel can reduce the carbon footprint by up to 26% for the pre-pandemic U.S. electric vehicle fleet.
events.description: Utilizing recycled aluminum and nickel can reduce the carbon footprint by up to 26% for the pre-pandemic U.S. electric vehicle fleet.

events.name: Ally-shoring strategy
events.wd_description: The study examined an ally-shoring strategy, reallocating production capacities for refined metals and battery components to Japan, South Korea, and European Union countries.
events.description: The study examined an ally-shoring strategy, reallocating production capacities for refined metals and battery components to Japan, South Korea, and European Union countries.

events.name: Key findings
events.wd_description: Key findings include a potential 27% reduction in carbon footprint by increasing onshoring and ally production, enhanced sustainability with renewable energy, and a 54% improvement in climate change mitigation with strategic integration.
events.description: Key findings include a potential 27% reduction in carbon footprint by increasing onshoring and ally production, enhanced sustainability with renewable energy, and a 54% improvement in climate change mitigation with strategic integration.

events.name: Environmental tradeoffs
events.wd_description: Reshoring could reduce ecotoxicity and particulate matter formation by over 30% from secondary nickel supply, but may decrease performance in ozone formation, ozone depletion, and ionizing radiation due to increased overseas transportation distance.
events.description: Reshoring could reduce ecotoxicity and particulate matter formation by over 30% from secondary nickel supply, but may decrease performance in ozone formation, ozone depletion, and ionizing radiation due to increased overseas transportation distance.

events.name: Importance of advanced modeling
events.wd_description: Advanced modeling and systems analysis are essential for considering environmental tradeoffs in lithium-ion battery production and securing a resilient value chain amidst uncertain markets and evolving technologies.
events.description: Advanced modeling and systems analysis are essential for considering environmental tradeoffs in lithium-ion battery production and securing a resilient value chain amidst uncertain markets and evolving technologies.
